title: FRONTLINE  Memory of the Camps 1985
description:
****WARNING**** NOT FOR THE SQUEAMISH,OR SENSITIVE!!! THIS FOOTAGE HAS UNYIELDING DEATH! DEATH CODE **9989** WAR MINISTRY

                                ****READ FIRST****

Sixty years ago, in the spring of 1945, Allied forces liberating Europe found evidence of atrocities which have tortured the world's conscience ever since. 
As the troops entered the German concentration camps, they made a systematic film record of what they saw. Work began in the summer of 1945 on the documentary, 
but the film was left unfinished. FRONTLINE found it stored in a vault of London's Imperial War Museum and, in 1985, broadcast it for the first time using the title the Imperial War Museum gave it the title "Memory of the Camps."

As the film's history shows, it was a project that was supervised by the British Ministry of Information and the American Office of War Information. 
And during that summer of 1945 some of the documentary editing was done under the direction of Alfred Hitchcock.
